alert.note: Alert for Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 11:54AM MDT until June 14 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Unprecedented flooding occurring on the following rivers in Montana... Stillwater River near Absarokee affecting Stillwater County. .Heavy rain falling on the snowpack over the Beartooth/Absaroka mountains has resulted in unprecedented rises on the Stillwater River. The river is currently higher than has ever been recorded at Absarokee. The river is currently peaking, and is expected to decrease through the remainder of the day into Tuesday as rainfall decreases and temperatures drop towards freezing in the higher elevations. If you live or are recreating near the river move to higher ground, and expect higher water levels than have previously been experienced. Additional updates to the river forecast and warning will be made as more information becomes available. For the Stillwater River...including Absarokee...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Stillwater River near Absarokee. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the last 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM MDT Monday was 10.0 feet. The river is currently peaking. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.4 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest has surpassed the previous record crest of 7.2 feet on 06/15/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Stillwater River Absarokee 7.5 9.8 Mon 9 am 6.4 5.5 5.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM MDT.
